259.description: b'Kevin walked into the kitchen while Alice did the same. Then, Kevin moved towards the kitchen cabinet and asked, "Could you possibly tell me where the juice and spoon are?" Alice, grabbing a wineglass, responded, "I noticed the juice and a spoon inside the kitchen cabinet." Kevin walked to the wineglass, while Alice walked to the dishwasher. Kevin then walked to another wineglass and grabbed it, while Alice opened the dishwasher.\n\nKevin walked to the kitchen table and placed the wineglass on it, while Alice grabbed the coffeepot. Kevin then walked to the spoon, grabbed it, and placed it on the kitchen table, while Alice put the coffeepot inside the dishwasher. Kevin walked back to the kitchen cabinet and opened it. He grabbed the juice and placed it on the kitchen table.'

questions.1:
Given the above interaction, if Alice wants to hinder Kevin from achieving his goal, which of the following locations did Alice least likely believe the juice was located when giving information?
    A) Living room
    B) Kitchen table
    C) Kitchen cabinet
questions.2:
Given the above interaction, if Alice wants to hinder Kevin from achieving his goal, which of the following objects did Alice least likely believe was located inside the kitchen cabinet when giving information?
    A) Juice
    B) Wineglass
    C) Fork
questions.3:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Alice believes that the juice is inside the kitchen cabinet, when giving information, Alice is most likely:
    A) Trying to help
    B) Trying to hinder
    C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
questions.4:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Alice believes that there is nothing worthwhile inside the kitchen cabinet, when giving information, Alice is most likely:
    A) Trying to help
    B) Trying to hinder
    C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
questions.5:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Alice believes the juice is only in the fridge, when giving information, Alice is most likely:
    A) Trying to help
    B) Trying to hinder
    C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
